intro: Gueldenstaedtia gracilis, commonly known as the slender false brome, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges, and is often found in disturbed soils. Gueldenstaedtia gracilis is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native environment.
